page.title: 10BLACKFORDBY
page.content: Blackfordby Primary School was built and opened in 1889 and it was then called St Margarets National School and owned by the church. In all there are 60 pupils in the school and the childrens lessons include:Maths,Reading and Writing,Cooking,Art and P.E(which is done in the local Village Hall.) School starts at 9:00am and finishes at 3:30pm. Their lunch is eaten in the mobile and their dinners are transported from Ashby Hill Top School by the Technical Services supplied by the North West Leicestershire District Council.On average 50 pupils attend for school dinners. The School House which is adjoining the main school,used to be lived in by the Headmaster.In the school grounds there are 2 air-raid shelters.
